posts.body:
>first red flag is mod support
>first
>Not removal of gender options for "inclusivity"
>Not the declaration that the game is heavily FPP
>Not the removal of in depth character creation
>Not the removal of rockerboys and other narratives
>Not the firing of the social network manager over #WontBeErased
>Not the Glassdoor reviews about bad project management and mishandling of employees
Yes, I'm sure mod support is the biggest pressing issue with CDPR and Cyberpunk 2077

>>714f2efb-faf9-4bed-9a57-55a7272fdd66
>>removal of in depth character creation
>What? Prove it

This one was a little hyperbolic, but it refers to the changes made in the recent reveal video. It may be in development, but they decided to show it in this state, without clarifying that it was only representative of the cc mechanic.

'''Remember:''' ''the disclaimer only says that it's not representative of the final look of the game''. We cannot assume that CDPR means anything outside of the words they've said, otherwise we have a repeat of the TPP/FPP cutscene controversy.

>>a660c187-0eff-44da-9b04-b2cffeb5ce0b
>>FPP
>Ok now what is this?
There's a bit of backlash that CDPR decided that most cutscenes are only in FPP. From what I gather, most people were upset that they'd hardly get to see their character, and supposedly they promised that you could switch from FPP to TPP at will. Obviously, this has changed and has resulted in the excuses seen in pic related.
